page.title: 08Noise Insulation.
page.content: We heard a few months ago that Prospect Vale School,built in 1962, were going to have a new roof and double glazing to prevent the noise of aeroplanes which is deafening. The school is on the flight path of most planes.Junior 2 classroom has planes going over every two minutes. During story-reading time the teacher has to stop reading aloud until the plane goes over. Even with 150 pupils talking it is hard to break the noise of the aircraft. The new scheme is to have a roof over three parts of the school and soundproofed windows. The roof will be held up by pillars situated all over the school. The cost is Â£250,000. Manchester Airport are paying around Â£200,000 and Stockport Education Committee Â£50,000.It will take approximately 6 months to instal. From October 1985 to Msrch,1986.
